The Environment Agency says the operators of Walleys Quarry will no longer accept waste from one of the companies who was trying to dispose of waste at the site. 

It says it will be investigating the waste operators whose rubbish was refused.
@ollyandpatch @HelenVi00175623 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency and that includes @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice total lack of action .

The update says four separate waste loads were rejected because it wasn‚Äôt what Walleys Quarry is allowed to accept. 

The Environment Agency says it is ‚Äòactively auditing‚Äô the supply chain of waste to the site.

#Mentalhealth is just as important as physical health. 

It‚Äôs OK to talk about your mental health and it‚Äôs OK not to be OK. 

If you‚Äôre suffering and you don‚Äôt know who to talk to @samaritans helpline is open around the clock on 116 123. 

Make sure you get the support you need. https://t.co/uSIAMp2Tl9

tweets.text: Brilliant to see @NaturalEngland giving #DearneValley Wetlands (including @RSPB_OldMoor) the legal protection needed to secure its future for nature & üëè to all who've worked so hard to make it so special @RSPBEngland, @GarganeyTrust @YorksWildlife @BarnsleyCouncil & @EnvAgency https://t.co/skY4lR5WgW

Works have begun on a new culvert in Threlkeld #Cumbria to reduce #FloodRisk to the local community. 

The new culvert will cross the road close to the entrance of Threlkeld Business Park & exit into the existing open channel at Town Cross. 

#ReducingFloodRisk https://t.co/igWhiAp010
@TheProspect1 @EnvAgencySW Such a shame. I noticed another empty nest on the other side of the river near the Port Royal. Eggs also gone...
